Norwegian whalers set sail for the Barents Sea on Monday as they kick off this year's hunt for minke whales, defying an international moratorium and angering environmentalists.
...
The Global Anti-Whaling Campaign, an umbrella organization of some 140 international associations, has criticized the Norwegian method of killing whales.
The whalers use harpoons tipped with grenades, intended to deliver a fatal nervous shock as they detonate inside a whale's body. Animal rights activists have described the method as "real torture."
